alert.note: Alert for Northern Worcester; Southern Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:23PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A thunderstorm will bring heavy rainfall to portions of south central Worcester County through 615 PM EDT... At 522 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Leicester, or 7 miles west of Worcester. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Shrewsbury, Holden, Auburn, Oxford, Millbury, Charlton, Spencer, Leicester, Sturbridge, Sutton, Rutland, West Boylston, Paxton, North Brookfield, Boylston, Brookfield, East Brookfield, Oakham, and New Braintree. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
